unit_learning_outcomes.description: Integrate an application with a database or other form of persistent storage
Demonstrate understanding of alternative SDLC lifecycle models
Demonstrate ability to communicate software requirements and designs, clearly and effectively.
Demonstrate an understanding of the concepts and tools needed to successfully design and build an application
Practice the key phases of the software development life cycle (SDLC) including requirements engineering, analysis, design, basic development and testing.

assessments.description: Quizzes to determine students individual strengths, weaknesses, knowledge and skills to develop a baseline of what students know about the topic.
This assignment will develop and test your skills in requirements gathering, specification, analysis and modelling.
This assignment will develop and test your skills in designing applications for the given case study
This assignment will develop and assess your design, development and testing applications for the given case study.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances
data.description: This unit is an intermediate unit to deliver a solid foundation in concepts, methods, tools and techniques that organisations use to control the information they use in their day-to-day business, with a particular focus on how computer-based technologies can most effectively contribute to the way business is structured. The units focuses on the fundamental concepts and models of applications development so that they can understand the key processes related to building functioning applications and appreciate the complexity of applications development. The unit emphasises program development and incorporates the software development life cycle, requirements gathering, designing a solution, and implementing and testing a solution in a programming language.
data.title: Applications Modelling and Development
